comment.text: This translation key is used to display a repeated invitation message. It appears on a button icon that can be clicked to send another invitation to a user when an existing one has been sent. Translators should provide a phrase that conveys the idea of sending a repeat request.

usage.context:
</Text>
 
 {showInviteIcon ? (
 <IconButton
 className="icon"
 title={t("Common:RepeatInvitation")}
 iconName={EmailPlusReactSvgUrl}
 isFill
 onClick={onRepeatInvitation}
 size={16}
 data-testid="info_panel_members_repeat_invitation_button"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Dəvəti təkrarlayın" literally translates to "Repeat the invitation." A more natural and accurate translation for 'Repeat invitation' (as a concept or label) would be something like 'Təkrar dəvət' or 'Təkrar göndərilən dəvət'. The current translation implies an action to be performed by the user.

While 'Renouveler l’invitation' is technically correct, it implies a renewal or reissuance of an existing invitation. 'Repeat invitation' often refers to sending the same invitation again. A more accurate translation would be 'Répéter l’invitation'.

The translation "もう一度招待する" (mou ichido shoutai suru) literally translates to 'invite again'. While conveying a similar meaning, 'repeat invitation' implies a continued or recurring invitation. A more accurate translation would depend on the specific context of 'Repeat Invitation'. Possible alternatives include "再度のご招待" (saisai no go-shoutai) or "継続的な招待" (keizoku-teki na shoutai).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider '再度のご招待' (saisai no go-shoutai) or '継続的な招待' (keizoku-teki na shoutai) for a more precise translation depending on context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Atkārtoti uzaicināt' is a literal translation of 'Repeat invitation,' it sounds unnatural in Latvian. A more appropriate translation would convey the meaning of 'repeatedly inviting' or a 'second invitation'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'Vēlreiz uzaicināt' (Invite again), 'Pievienota atkārtota aicinājuma' (Added repeat invitation) depending on the context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'ආරාධනය නැවතත්' (aaradhnaya naavaathath) literally translates to 'invitation again'. While understandable, it lacks the nuance of 'repeat' which implies a second or subsequent invitation. A more accurate translation might convey the idea of 're-invitation' or 'another invitation'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a translation that emphasizes 're-invitation' or 'another invitation'. For example: 'නැවත ආරාධනය' (naaevaatha aaradhnaya - re-invitation) or 'ඊනියා ආරාධනය' (eenia aaradhnaya - another invitation).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Понови позивницу" is understandable, it's a somewhat literal translation of 'repeat'. A more natural and idiomatic translation for 'Repeat invitation' would be 'Поновите позивницу' (formal) or 'Понови позив' (slightly less formal, omitting 'позивницу'). The original translation implies a direct repetition of an invitation, whereas the English phrase often implies resending or reminding someone about an invitation.

While 'Ponovi pozivnicu' is technically a valid sentence, it's not the most natural or idiomatic translation of 'Repeat invitation'. It implies 'repeat the act of sending an invitation'. A more accurate and natural translation would be 'Ponovljeni poziv' or 'Ponovno slanje pozivnice'.

The translation "Daveti tekrarla" literally means "Repeat the invitation." While understandable, it's not the most natural way to convey the meaning of "Repeat invitation." A more natural translation might imply sending another invitation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider "Tekrar davet et" (Invite again) or "Başka bir davet gönder" (Send another invitation).
